model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I found a lot of beginner recipes online for you to try. If your husband likes Asian food I found a few recipes you may want to try. Most pressure cookers also make rice. 
Oh my! Thank you so much for that. Which recipe do you think I should start with?
I think shrimp fried rice would be a good place to start.  It's simple and not a lot of ingredients. What do you think?
Does it have eggs in it? We grow our own eggs so that might be the perfect starting point.
Yes, it contains eggs.  I think you would do well with the fried rice. It's best to cook the rice the day before.  
I didn't know that. Why cook the rice beforehand? Is it better to age rice or something?
The rice needs to be cool before adding to the pan.  Are you able to take a passenger along in you truck?
Oh! That makes since. I didn't realize that the temperature made a difference when frying rice. As for the truck, Yes I can. But, depending on what company I'm working for at the time, they often set restrictions on passengers.
The rice tends to stick together if it's warm.  I would like to ride along with you sometime when you're able.
I actually have a scheduled haul for next Wednesday. Do you want to come along for that ride? It should take about five hours.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Pressure Cooker and Cooking Tips', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A explains the use of a pressure cooker in cooking and provides tips on its benefits, recipes, and recommendations.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: What a tandoor? Is it similar to a pressure cooker? ### Speaker A: No, a tandoor is a special type of oven which they use in India to make tandoori chicken. It helps give it its flavour. It is made from clay. ### Speaker B: Oh I see! I've never used a pressure cooker before. Does it cook other things other than lentils? I hear it makes the cooking go much faster. ### Speaker A: Yes, you can do lots of things in pressure cookers like stews and soups. Most of the time, I use it to soften meat. I love putting my lamb shanks in there. It makes the meat fall right off the bone. Do you have a pressure cooker? ### Speaker B: I don't, but hearing what you're saying makes me want to purchase one for my husband. He's an avid cook but sometimes that makes the cooking process a lot longer than I want! ### Speaker A: I would recommend a pressure cooker. It is a great item for beginner cooks. You throw it all in, pop the lid on and wait for the whistle really. I gave one to my sister for Christmas and she uses more often than me now.' }
```

Brief explanation: The DIALOGUE CONTEXT involves a discussion about cooking shrimp fried rice and organizing a ride-along in a truck. MEMORY contains related information about using pressure cookers for cooking, which aligns with the initial part of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT regarding rice cooking. However, it doesn't provide specific insights into the shrimp fried rice recipe or the ride-along plans, which are the focal points of the current scenario. Thus, MEMORY is only partially relevant and not directly helpful.
